intro: Manglietia guangzhouensis, commonly known as Guangzhou manglietia, is a rare evergreen shrub native to southern China. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae, which includes some of the earliest flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, ovate leaves and showy, white flowers with a strong fragrance. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within evergreen forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
